prompt:

Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: A particular set of circumstances led to her being adopted by Mr. Wright. A world-class magician on the rise.
Character 1
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The youngest lawyer in our agency. She apparently studied psychology in Europe.
Character 2
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My boss. He taught me a lot about what it means to be a lawyer.
Character 3
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A prosecutor from Khura'in. He's also a monk, which explains why he's known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 4
Name: Dhurke Sahdmadhi
Description: Leader of the Defiant Dragons, and the man who raised me. He was a lawyer once.
Character 5
Name: Archie Buff
Description: An archeologist in Kurain Village. He was asked by someone to study the Founder's Orb.
Character 6
Name: Datz Are'bal
Description: A member of the Defiant Dragons, and Dhurke's right-hand man. He's always been one to laugh at just about anything.
Character 7
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective. It looks like she finally became the forensics investigator she always wanted to be.
Character 8
Name: Paul Atishon
Description: He's looking to represent Kurain Village. His remarkable self-confidence is blinding.
Character 9
Name: Sergeant Buff → Armie Buff
Description: The doctor's reclusive child. He lost his mother in a fire.
Character 10
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Ms. Maya Fey's cousin. She's also one of Kurain Village's spirit mediums. She's always really courteous.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: Mr. Wright's best friend and the district's chief prosecutor. His frilly cravat makes a strong fashion statement.
Character 12
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mr. Wright's former assistant. She's currently training in Khura'in. I'm told she can channel the dead.
Character 13
Name: Inga Karkhuul Khura'in
Description: Khura'in's Minister of Justice and the kingdom's second-in-command.
Character 14
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: Daughter of Ga'ran and princess of Khura'in who is more than a little spoiled.
Character 15
Name: Ga'ran Sigatar Khura'in
Description: The grand priestess and queen of Khura'in. It's said that she can channel the dead.
Character 16
Name: Nayna
Description: Rayfa's attendant. She disappeared all of a sudden after Minister Inga's death.
Character 17
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: When not undergoing monastic training, this plucky kid works as a tour guide.
Character 18
Name: Amara Sigatar Khura'in
Description: The previous queen. She is a spirit medium known as the grand priestess and possesses incredible spiritual power.

Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician and my daughter. I adopted her nine years ago.
Character 20
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The newest lawyer in my office with a background in psychology.

Description: A reliable subordinate at my office. Serious and hot-blooded with vocal chords made of steel.

Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 23
Name: Dhurke Sahdmadhi
Description: Leader of the Defiant Dragons and Apollo's adoptive father.
Character 24
Name: Datz Are'bal
Description: The Defiant Dragons' XO and Dhurke's right-hand man. He will laugh at just about anything.
Character 25
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensics investigator.
Character 26
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: The district's chief prosecutor and my childhood friend. We used to go head-to-head back in his courtroom days.
Character 27
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 28
Name: Inga Karkhuul Khura'in
Description: Khura'in's Minister of Justice. He was killed during the hostage exchange.

Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in

Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.
Evidence 1
Name: Founder's Orb
Description: A national treasure of the Kingdom of Khura'in. None but those of in the royal family have laid eyes on it. Heating the Founder's Orb revealed the statue within. The founder's form has appeared from within. It seems only the queen knows the founder's real name.
Evidence 2
Name: Photo of My Father
Description: A picture of my biological father, Jove Justice, who died in Khura'in.
Evidence 3

Evidence 8
Name: Glowing Moss

Evidence 10

Evidence 11
Name: Raincoat

Evidence 12
Name: Robbery Report
Description: A report filed a year ago by one Mr. Paul Atishon-Wimperson for the theft of the Crystal of Ami Fey.
Evidence 13
Name: Dr. Buff's Autopsy Report
Description: Dr. Buff was struck with the corner of some object. The time of death is between 10 and 11 PM.
Evidence 14
Name: Armie's Statement
Description: She'd fled to her room when she realized someone had moved her while she'd been unconscious on the second floor.
Evidence 15
Name: Inga's Autopsy Report
Description: Stabbed from behind. Cause of death is blood loss. Time of death is approximately 3 PM.
Evidence 16
Name: Tomb Diagram
Description: A diagram of the crime scene. Amara's sarcophagus is in the very center of the room.
Evidence 17
Name: Tomb Crime Photo
Description: A photo of Inga's body. He was stabbed in the back with a knife.
Evidence 18
Name: Gemstone
Description: Inga's button, discovered in the ashes of the tomb's incense burners. Caked in soot.
Evidence 19
Name: Pink Butterfly Pendant
Description: A pendant adorned with a pink butterfly. Seems it belongs to Dhurke. Stained with the victim's blood. A locket found at the crime scene. It actually belongs to Amara.
Evidence 20
Name: Mysterious Bloodstain
Description: A bloodstain from Amara's Tomb. This bloodstain found had been wiped up by someone. Analysis reveals that it's Dhurke's blood.
Evidence 21
Name: Painkiller Shots
Description: The medication Inga used for his back pain. Said to make the pain disappear.
Evidence 22
Name: Inga's Notepad
Description: A notepad used by Inga. People's characteristics are written inside.
Evidence 23
Name: Woman's Photo
Description: A photo showing Dhurke and Amara's life on the run about 23 years ago. [caption] Amara is holding a baby, sitting on a chair. Behind her are some books. One of the books has the logo of the Defiant Dragons on its cover.
Evidence 24
Name: Channeling Photo
Description: A picture taken at around 2 PM of the channeling rite.
Evidence 25
Name: Ahlbi's Statement
Description: At around 2 PM, Shah'do was surprised by a firecracker, ran into the courtyard, spooked Nayna and stole her hat.
Evidence 26
Name: Amara's Assassination File
Description: A file containing a ton of info on the assassination of Amara Sigatar Khura'in.
Evidence 27
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: A document establishing the Defense Culpability Act in the name of the queen.
Evidence 28
Name: Dhurke's Badge
Description: The symbol of Dhurke's creed: "A dragon never yields." Nahyuta never confiscated it.
Evidence 29
Name: Dhurke's Corpse Photo
Description: More than three days have passed since his death death. He was shot three times in the chest.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was struck by a sudden dizziness the moment I entered the tomb.
Person: Dhurke
Testimony 1
Testimony: The next thing I knew, I was standing there with a bloody knife in my hand.
Person: Dhurke
Testimony 2
Testimony: The possibility of a third party being there in the tomb is probably nonexistent.
Person: Dhurke
Testimony 3
Testimony: And lying right in front of me was Inga, dead as a doornail.
Person: Dhurke
Testimony 4
Testimony: I've no recollection of what happened in the interim.
Person: Dhurke
Testimony 5
Testimony: I don't have a motive for killing Inga. After all, me and my ilk seek a bloodless revolution.
Person: Dhurke
Testimony 6
Testimony: But I didn't kill him. At least, I don't think I did. It'd go against everything I believe in.
Person: Dhurke
Testimony 7
Testimony: Though, I guess there's no evidence that proves I didn't kill him either...
Person: Dhurke

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let's start by going through the testimonies and evidences one by one.

First, the testimonies are all from Dhurke. Let me look at each one. Testimony 0 says he was struck by dizziness upon entering the tomb. Testimony 1 mentions he found himself with a bloody knife. Testimony 2 claims there was probably no third party in the tomb. Testimony 3 says he saw Inga dead in front of him. Testimony 4 is that he doesn't remember what happened in between. Testimony 5 states he has no motive because he's for a bloodless revolution. Testimony 6 he denies killing Inga, and 7 admits there's no evidence he didn't.

Now, looking at the evidences. Let's check each for contradictions. The key is to find evidence that directly contradicts one of Dhurke's statements.

Evidence 19 is the Pink Butterfly Pendant. It says the pendant is stained with the victim's blood and actually belongs to Amara. But wait, Dhurke's testimony 6 says he didn't kill Inga. However, the pendant being his and having blood might link him to the murder. Wait, the evidence says it's Amara's, though. Maybe not directly.

Evidence 20 is a bloodstain from Amara's Tomb, which is Dhurke's blood. If Dhurke was there and his blood is present, but he claims not to have killed Inga. But his own testimony says he was there and found the body. So maybe that's not a contradiction.

Evidence 23 is a photo of Dhurke and Amara 23 years ago. The caption mentions a Defiant Dragons logo on a book. If Dhurke's group was active back then, maybe his motive could be connected, but he says he has no motive. Hmm. Not sure if that's a direct contradiction.

Evidence 15 is Inga's autopsy report: stabbed from behind, died around 3 PM. Testimony 3 says Dhurke found Inga dead. But how does that contradict? The time of death could be relevant. If there's evidence that someone else was present around that time, but Dhurke says no third party (Testimony 2). Wait, Testimony 2 says there was probably no third party. But if other evidence suggests a third party was present, that would contradict.

Looking at Evidence 25: Ahlbi's Statement. At around 2 PM, Shah'do was startled by a firecracker, leading to Nayna losing her hat. If Inga died at 3 PM, but Ahlbi's statement is about 2 PM. Not directly related to the tomb.

Evidence 24 is a Channeling Photo taken around 2 PM. If Inga died at 3 PM, maybe that's a timeline. But Dhurke's testimony about being in the tomb and the time of death. Wait, the autopsy report (Evidence 15) says Inga died around 3 PM. Dhurke's Testimony 0 says he entered the tomb and got dizzy. If the murder happened at 3 PM, and Dhurke was there, but he claims no memory. However, if other evidence shows someone else was present, that would contradict Testimony 2.

Wait, Evidence 25's statement might relate to Nayna's movements. If Nayna was in the courtyard at 2 PM, but if she was involved in the murder at 3 PM, maybe. But how does that link to Dhurke's testimony? His Testimony 2 says no third party. If there's evidence someone else was there, like Nayna (Character 16, 31), who disappeared after Inga's death. But Evidence 25 says Shah'do spooked Nayna at 2 PM, so she was present then. If Inga died at 3 PM, maybe she could have been there. But Dhurke's testimony says no third party. So if Nayna was present, that's a contradiction. But where's the evidence?

Alternatively, Evidence 19: the pendant is Amara's, but found at the scene. If Dhurke had it, but he didn't mention that. Not sure.

Wait, Evidence 20 is Dhurke's bloodstain. If he was injured, maybe that's why he had blood, but he said he found the body with a knife. If his blood is there, but he didn't mention being injured. Wait, but his testimony 0 says he was dizzy, maybe implying he was attacked. But the bloodstain is his, which might indicate he was there before. Hmm, but how does that contradict his testimony?

Wait, Testimony 2: Dhurke says no third party. If there's evidence that someone else was present, like Nayna (since her hat was taken by Shah'do), but that's at 2 PM. The murder was at 3 PM. Maybe not directly. Alternatively, Evidence 18 is a gemstone (Inga's button) in the incense burner. If someone else took it there, that could imply a third party. But Dhurke's Testimony 2 says no third party. So if the button was moved by someone else, that's a contradiction. But how is that linked?

Alternatively, Evidence 23 (the photo with the Defiant Dragons book) might indicate that Amara was connected to the Defiant Dragons 23 years ago. If Dhurke's group is the Defiant Dragons, and Amara was part of it, maybe there's a motive. But Dhurke in Testimony 5 says he has no motive because they want a bloodless revolution. If Amara was his ally, but Inga was the Minister of Justice, maybe there's a motive. But this is more about motive than direct contradiction.

Wait, Testimony 5: Dhurke says he has no motive. But if Evidence 23 shows Amara with Defiant Dragons, and Inga was against them, perhaps Dhurke had a motive to kill Inga. So that would contradict his testimony. But the question is about a contradiction between evidence and testimony. So if the evidence shows a possible motive that Dhurke denies, then Evidence 23 contradicts Testimony 5. That could be a pair.

But let me check: Testimony 5: "I don't have a motive for killing Inga. After all, me and my ilk seek a bloodless revolution." Evidence 23: Photo showing Amara (the previous queen) with Dhurke, and a book with Defiant Dragons logo. If Amara was part of the Defiant Dragons, then Inga (as Minister of Justice) might be opposing them. So Dhurke could have a motive to eliminate Inga. Therefore, Evidence 23 contradicts Testimony 5, implying Dhurke does have a motive.

Alternatively, maybe Evidence 19 (the pendant) being stained with blood and belonging to Amara. If Amara was channeled by someone, or if Dhurke had her pendant, maybe linking him to the crime. But Dhurke's testimony is that he didn't kill Inga, but if his pendant is there with blood, that's evidence against him. Wait, the evidence says the pendant is Amara's but stained with the victim's blood. So if Amara's pendant is at the scene, perhaps indicating she was there. But how does that contradict Dhurke's testimony? Unless Amara was channeled, but Ga'ran is the current queen who can channel. Hmm.

Alternatively, Evidence 15: Inga's time of death is 3 PM. Testimony 3 says Dhurke found Inga dead. If the Channeling Photo (Evidence 24) was taken at 2 PM, showing a channeling rite, perhaps involving someone else. But not sure.

Wait, another angle. Testimony 2: Dhurke claims no third party was present. But Evidence 25 (Ahlbi's statement) says that at 2 PM, Shah'do spooked Nayna, causing her hat to be stolen. If Nayna was present in the area, perhaps she was in the tomb later. But the time of death is 3 PM. If Nayna disappeared after Inga's death (Evidence 16/31), maybe she was involved. Therefore, her presence would contradict Dhurke's Testimony 2. But how is that evidenced? The link is through Ahlbi's statement (Evidence 25) that Nayna was in the courtyard at 2 PM, and she later disappeared. If she was in the tomb at 3 PM, then she's a third party. So Testimony 2 says no third party, but Evidence 25 suggests Nayna was around. But that's a stretch since the time difference is an hour. Alternatively, maybe another evidence.

Wait, Evidence 19: the pendant is Amara's. If Amara was channeled by someone (like Ga'ran), and she was present, but Dhurke didn't mention that. But that's speculative.

Alternatively, Evidence 20: bloodstain is Dhurke's. If he was injured and left blood, but he didn't mention being injured. His Testimony 0 says he felt dizzy upon entering, maybe implying he was attacked, but he didn't mention any injury. The bloodstain could indicate he was hurt, which he didn't explain, but his testimony 4 says he doesn't remember. So maybe not a direct contradiction.

Wait, going back. The key contradiction would be where evidence directly shows that something Dhurke said is false. For example, Testimony 2: "The possibility of a third party being there in the tomb is probably nonexistent." If there's evidence that a third party was there, that would contradict.

Evidence 18: Gemstone (Inga's button) found in the incense burner. If Inga was stabbed from behind (Evidence 15), maybe the button came off during a struggle. If the button was found in the incense burner, which is ashes, perhaps someone tried to hide it. If Dhurke didn't do that, then a third party might have. So if the button was moved, then a third party was present, contradicting Testimony 2. But how to link that? The gemstone is Inga's button, found in the ashes. If Dhurke killed Inga, he might have left the button there, but if someone else moved it, that's a third party. However, this requires assuming that Dhurke wouldn't have moved the button. Not sure.

Alternatively, Evidence 25: Ahlbi's statement about Shah'do causing Nayna to lose her hat at 2 PM. If Nayna was present, and later at 3 PM, the time of Inga's death, she could have been in the tomb. If so, then Dhurke's Testimony 2 is false because Nayna was a third party. But the timing is an hour apart. Not sure if that's enough.

Wait, let's look at Evidence 23 again: the photo shows Amara holding a baby, with a Defiant Dragons book in the background. This implies that Amara was connected to the Defiant Dragons. If Dhurke is their leader, this could mean he had a motive related to Amara. So if Inga was against the Defiant Dragons, Dhurke might want to eliminate him. Thus, contradicting Testimony 5 where Dhurke claims no motive. So Evidence 23 contradicts Testimony 5. That seems plausible.

Alternatively, Evidence 19 (the pendant) is stained with the victim's blood and belongs to Amara. If Amara was channeled by Ga'ran, but that's not clear. If the pendant was at the scene, maybe Amara (or someone channeling her) was present, making Dhurke's Testimony 2 about no third party incorrect. But this is speculative.

Wait, the key is to find a direct contradiction. Let's think of Testimony 2: no third party. If there's evidence that someone else was in the tomb, that would contradict. Evidence 18: Inga's button in the incense burner. If the killer moved the button there, but if Dhurke did it, that's possible. But if the button was moved after the murder, maybe by someone else. Alternatively, the Mysterious Bloodstain (Evidence 20) is Dhurke's blood. If he was there and bled, but he says he doesn't remember. But that's not a direct contradiction.

Wait, another angle. Testimony 3: Dhurke says he found Inga dead in front of him. But the autopsy report (Evidence 15) says Inga was stabbed from behind. If Dhurke found him lying dead, but the wound is from behind, that implies the attacker was behind Inga. If Dhurke was in front, maybe he couldn't have stabbed him from behind. Wait, but if Inga was stabbed from behind, then the attacker was behind him. So if Dhurke found Inga lying dead, and he had the knife, but the stab came from behind, maybe he couldn't have done it unless he attacked from behind. But if he was in front, then someone else did it. So perhaps the contradiction is between the stab wound's location (from behind) and Dhurke's presence in front. But how does that tie to evidence?

Wait, the autopsy report (Evidence 15) says Inga was stabbed from behind. Testimony 3 says Dhurke was standing over the body. If Dhurke was in front, then he couldn't have stabbed from behind, implying someone else did it. But Dhurke's testimony 2 says there was no third party. So if the evidence shows the stab was from behind, but Dhurke was in front, then the killer must have been someone else, contradicting his statement that there was no third party. Therefore, Evidence 15 (autopsy report) contradicts Testimony 2 (no third party).

Wait, but Testimony 2 is Dhurke's claim that no third party was present. If the stab came from behind, and Dhurke was in front, then the actual attacker would have to be behind Inga. Therefore, unless Dhurke moved around, which he doesn't mention, the attacker would be a third party. Thus, the autopsy report (Evidence 15) showing the stab from behind contradicts Dhurke's Testimony 2 that there was no third party.

So the contradiction is Evidence 15 (autopsy report stating Inga was stabbed from behind) and Testimony 2 (Dhurke claiming no third party). Because if Dhurke was the only one there, he would have had to stab Inga from behind, but he found himself in front of the body with the knife. The positioning doesn't add up unless there was someone else.
